newsitem.title: THAILAND: Bank of Ayudhya up despite rating cut.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Ayudhya up despite rating cut.

text.p: Bank of Ayudhya Plc's shares were up in early trade on Wednesday despite a Standard & Poor's decision to cut the bank's short-term counterparty rating.
After 10 minutes of trading, the share price had risen one baht to 72 on turnover of 12,500 shares.
"There are buying orders for the share above previous closing prices. The market appeared to dismiss news of the bank's ratings downgrade," said a broker at Nava Finance and Securities.
Rating agency S&P said on Wednesday it lowered Bank of Ayudhya's short-term counterparty rating to "A3" from "A2".
But the rating agency affirmed its "BBB" long-term counterparty rating on the bank.
The rating outlook was negative, reflecting concerns that the economic downturn and resulting asset quality problems would be higher and more prolonged than anticipated, it said.
"The rating concern of most banking shares had already been discounted after the Moody's cut of the country's sovereign rating," the broker at Nava said.
Moody's Investors Servics last week downgraded the foreign currency ceilings for bonds and bank deposits of Thailand to A3 from A2.
